definition[0]: a person or organization that does not follow the generally accepted way of doing something
example[0]: The area is one of the last great holdouts in the Northeast against suburban shopping malls.
definition[1]: a CREDITOR (=a person or organization to whom money is owed) that refuses the official plan to reorganize a bankrupt company
example[1]: With its reorganization plan approved by creditors representing two-thirds or more of its debt, holdouts are obliged by court order to go along with the plan.
